It would seem that the issue of substrate hidden nodes is mitigated 
somewh=
at by the fact that in certain instances they are nothing more 
than duplic=
ated substrate input and/or output nodes, created for the 
sole purpose of =
handling input-to-input or output-to-input 
connections, due to the current=
 limitation that a) nodes only have 
one unique input, and b) an input has =
no activation function. In this 
case, the dimensionality of the clone node=
 may reasonably carry with 
it the dimensionality of the original.

A true =
substrate hidden (i.e. not a computational dupe), would not 
have a clear d=
imensionality associated with it. So the question is, 
is there a meaningfu=
l way to present a true substrate hidden node to 
a hypercube network, or s=
imply have the hypercube network ignore the 
true substrate hidden nodes, a=
nd evolve the true substrate hidden 
nodes and associated connections to wh=
atever, in the substrate 
network separate from the hypercube network (i.e.=
 hypercube network 
only operates on "b" & "c" for PSIs and PSOs, and their=
 clones).

Other thoughts and/or comments are appreciated!
Thanks,
   Andy =
Carl



--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "afcarl2" <a.carl@...> wrote:
>
> Give=
n an arbitrary point "P" in design space, comprised of the 
> following:
> =
(a) problem specific inputs (PSIs);
> (b) auxiliary additional parameters a=
ssociated w/ PSIs;
> (c) problem specific outputs (PSOs);
> (d) auxiliary a=
dditional parameters associated w/ PSOs;
> 
> An instance of a struct of it=
ems identified in (a) through (d) 
above, 
> which taken together comprise =
a design point P[i], a vector of 
which 
> comprises the current substrate =
resolution.
> 
> Substrate Inputs: comprised of PSIs, "a" above;
> Substrat=
e Outputs: comprised of PSOs, "c" above;
> 
> Hypercube Inputs: comprised o=
f auxiliary additional parameters 
> associated w/ PSIs & PSOs, "b" & "d" a=
bove;
> Hypercube Output: weight between current pair of nodes
> 
> Questio=
ns:
> (1) When the dimensionality of "b" and "d" differ, how is the 
> hype=
rcube input topology reconciled?
> (2) Are there different hypercube networ=
ks depending on if the 
> current node (input or output), is a substrate in=
put, hidden or 
> output node?
> (3) How are substrate hidden nodes handled=
 when the hypercube is 
> focused on the associated connecting substrate we=
ight? (variation 
on 
> question 2)
> 
> Thanks,
>    Andy Carl
